title: Amazon Basics Digital Kitchen Scale - Does the Job Without Breaking the Bank
metaDescription: Honest review of the Amazon Basics digital kitchen scale. Simple, accurate, and gets the job done - but there are a few quirks to know about.
content:
## Look, I'll be straight with you upfront

This Amazon Basics kitchen scale isn't going to win any design awards, but it does exactly what you need it to do without any fuss. I've been using it for several months now, and while it's not fancy, it's become one of those reliable kitchen tools I actually reach for.

## What actually matters: accuracy and ease of use

The thing that impressed me most? It's genuinely accurate. I tested it against some known weights when I first got it, and it was spot-on every time. The LCD display is clear and easy to read, even in different lighting conditions. You don't have to squint or angle your head to see the numbers, which is more important than you'd think when you're juggling ingredients.

The tare function works exactly like it should. Hit the button, and it zeros out whatever's already on there. Perfect for when you're adding multiple ingredients to the same bowl or want to weigh something in its container. I use this constantly when I'm baking - throw the mixing bowl on there, zero it out, then add each ingredient one by one.

## Build quality that surprised me

For something this basic, the construction is actually pretty solid. The stainless steel top feels substantial, not flimsy like some cheaper scales I've tried. It's easy to wipe clean, and I haven't noticed any scratching or wear after months of regular use. The black plastic base feels sturdy too, though it does show fingerprints pretty easily.

The platform is a good size - not huge, but big enough for most mixing bowls and plates. I can fit a standard dinner plate on there without any overhang, which covers most of what I need to weigh.

## The battery situation

It comes with batteries included, which is nice. I'm still on the original set after several months of regular use, so the battery life seems pretty good. The scale automatically shuts off after a few minutes of inactivity, which definitely helps extend battery life.

## Multiple units actually come in handy

You can switch between grams, ounces, pounds, and even milliliters for water. I mostly stick to grams for baking (way more precise than cups for flour), but having the option to switch to ounces or pounds is useful when I'm portioning out meat or measuring larger quantities.

## The not-so-great parts

The response time can be a bit slow sometimes. It's not terrible, but there's definitely a second or two lag when you first put something on the scale. Not a huge deal, but worth noting if you're impatient like me.

Also, it's pretty sensitive to being perfectly level. If your counter isn't completely flat, you might get slightly different readings depending on where exactly you place it. I had to find the right spot on my counter where it sits level.

The display, while clear, isn't backlit. In really dim lighting, it can be a bit hard to read. Not a dealbreaker, but something to consider if your kitchen doesn't have great lighting.

## Who should actually get this

If you're just getting into baking or cooking and want something reliable without spending a fortune, this is a solid choice. It's also great if you're trying to portion control or meal prep - having accurate measurements makes a real difference.

It's probably not the best choice if you need something super heavy-duty or if you're weighing really tiny amounts (like spices for advanced cooking). The 11-pound limit covers most home cooking needs, but if you regularly need to weigh bigger items, you'll want something with a higher capacity.

## Bottom line

This scale does what it promises without any unnecessary bells and whistles. It's accurate, easy to clean, and the price point makes it accessible for most people. Sure, there are fancier options out there, but for basic kitchen weighing needs, this gets the job done reliably.
pros: Reliable tare function that actually works
Solid stainless steel surface that's easy to clean
Good battery life with auto shut-off feature
Multiple unit options (grams, ounces, pounds, ml)
Decent-sized platform fits most bowls and plates
cons: Slightly slow response time when adding items
Sensitive to surface levelness - needs flat counter
Display isn't backlit for dim lighting conditions
verdict: This is a straightforward, reliable kitchen scale that handles basic weighing needs without any fuss. It's not fancy, but it's accurate and well-built enough to be worth the investment for most home cooks.
targetAudience: Home bakers, meal preppers, and anyone wanting accurate food measurements without spending a lot on premium features
